about_the_game:
Disclosure

Please note that this is a very old game, originally published in 2002. It is still fun, but it runs on a 4:3 screen ratio, and a lot has happened in the gaming industry between 2002 and now.

The hero can be a scoundrel!

Engeor, a first-year student at the magical university, becomes one of many victims of the Moharn dictator Wahargem, who is considered a living legend. More than ten years ago, he stood on the highest floor of the Skeldal Tower and, along with his comrades, won the victorious battle at the gate to the forbidden dimension of Zohar. But even a legend does not have the right to destroy someone's life, so Engeor decides to confront not only him but also his own fate.

Genre Combination

The point-and-click adventure, a genre so popular in the nineties, has been supplemented with RPG character development, where the main hero learns spells that are used not only in hexagonal turn-based battles but also for solving adventure tasks.

short_description: The Fifth Disciple is a classic point-and-click adventure with turn-based battles from 2002. It tells the story of Engeor, a student at a magical university, who becomes one of the random victims of the regime, and his journey to overthrow the Moharn dictator Wahargem.
